title: Conc. of Fe2+ from permanganate titration

content.prompt:
5 Fe2+ + MnO4– + 8 H+ ⇄ 5 Fe3+ + Mn2+ + 4 H2O

In a titration experiment based on the equation above, 25.0 milliliters of an acidified Fe2+ solution requires 14.0 milliliters of standard 0.050–molar MnO4– solution to reach the equivalence point. The concentration of Fe2+ in the original solution is

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
